News

Suffolk Libraries Day 2019 hailed as a success

Written by James Powell · Published Nov 18, 2019

The very first Suffolk Libraries Day, held on Saturday 12 October, raised £16,400 and brought an extra 4,000 visitors to the county’s libraries.

Suffolk Libraries adopts feathery friends to celebrate pre-school relaunch

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Nov 18, 2019

We recently sponsored Ural owls Bea and Bumble at Suffolk Owl Sanctuary as real-life counterparts to Oona, our new young children's mascot.

Take part in OverDrive's Big Library Read for November 2019

Written by Alice Violett · Published Oct 31, 2019

From 4 - 18 November, you can borrow I'm Not Dying With You Tonight by Gilly Segal & Kimberly Jones on OverDrive without a wait list and join in a worldwide discussion.

Lesley’s Readers on BBC Radio Suffolk – book choice for November

Written by Alice Violett · Published Oct 28, 2019

This month Lesley will be discussing The Butterfly Room, by Lucinda Riley.

Suffolk Libraries introduces new animal-themed library card for 0-5 year-olds

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Oct 25, 2019

Libraries in Suffolk have introduced a new card design for pre-school children as part of a relaunch of their activities for young children and their parents/carers.

7-11 year-olds invited to enter our Winter Story competition with Imagine That

Written by James Powell · Published Oct 23, 2019

Suffolk Libraries is partnering with local children's book publisher Imagine That to offer Suffolk children the chance to win a space at a special winter storybook writing workshop.

Rosehill Library launches opening hours consultation

Written by Alice Violett · Published Oct 23, 2019

Suffolk Libraries are asking people living in the Rosehill area their views on potential changes to the library’s opening hours.

Suffolk Libraries shortlisted for funding to develop ‘Happy Place’ project

Written by James Powell · Published Oct 21, 2019

A Suffolk Libraries project has been announced as one of ten finalists in the Nesta Challenges Tech to Connect competition.

October half-term events at Suffolk Libraries

Written by Alice Violett · Published Oct 15, 2019

Children and families are invited to join us for author events, performances, arts and crafts and more this half-term.

Celebrate your favourite children's books at Waveney Kids' Book Festival

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Oct 10, 2019

Southwold and Beccles libraries will be hosting a variety of events and activities with the theme of books, writing and drawing for children of all ages this October half-term.
